N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4002.28 - License requirements for jockey

State Regulations

In addition to the requirements of sections
4002.8
and
4002.29
of this Part, a full
jockey's license (initial and renewal) may be issued only to an applicant who
(a) meets the requirements of an
apprentice jockey in section
4002.27
of this Part; (b) can demonstrate good physical condition
for a jockey; and
(c) has
demonstrated to the stewards a competence of riding ability, which may include
consideration of the recommendations from the starter, head outrider and the
designated representatives of the jockeys and the horsemen of the racetrack. The demonstration of ability shall include the ability to break with a horse in
company from the starting gate, working a horse in company around a turn and
down a stretch, switching a crop from one hand to the other while maintaining
control of the horse in a stretch drive, and causing a horse to switch lead
coming out of a turn. Notes
